It is hard to say what might be wrong. maybe you have either 1. wrong keyboard in /etc/X11/xorg.conf 2. wrong language setting in /etc/X11/xorg.conf or 3. both. do you have any experience in altering that file?
i have muckled about abit in it yes
have a look at the Option "XkbModel" "pc10x" if the wrong number of keys are set there you might have that sort of problem. example: you have 102 key keyboard and have 105 in xorg.conf
Option  "XkbModel" "pc105" <-- i have a laptop, what should i use here?
i can't say for sure. I don't have a laptop anywhere near here. try pc102, and also see that Option "XkbLayout" is set to your language ("se" for swedish, "fi" for finnish etc)
after changing i need to restart x right?
normally, if you have a "windows" key and a "menu" key on your keyboard it should be 105. but then again, i can not say for sure. yes, after the change you need to restart X.
make a backup of xorg.conf before changing it
ok... thnx
it didn't work... it is like my delete key and backspace key are mapped to the same key
try to hit "num lock" and see if that's what messing it up
i don't have numlock, it is a laptop, and it is in all apps

you absolutely have a num-lock even on a laptop. on a laptop, if the numlock is disabled (or enabled, depends on the laptop model usually), some keys on the keyboard act as a normal numerical keypad. tunring it on/off will enable/disable this feature.
if all else fail, run "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" and chose the default options, then restart X. your keyboard should (hopefully) be set to the correct settings.
